articles.author: SEAN MURPHY and JULIO CORTEZ
articles.description: VALLEY VIEW, Texas (AP) — Powerful storms killed at least 13 people and left a wide trail of destruction Sunday across Texas, Oklahoma and Arkansas after obliterating homes and destroying a truck stop where dozens sought shelter in a restroom during the latest deadly weather to strike the central U.S.
articles.title: At least 13 dead in Texas, Oklahoma and Arkansas after severe weather roars across region

articles.author: WAFAA SHURAFA, TIA GOLDENBERG and SAMY MAGDY
articles.description: DEIR AL-BALAH, Gaza Strip (AP) — Hamas fired a barrage of rockets from Gaza that set off air raid sirens as far away as Tel Aviv for the first time in months on Sunday in a show of resilience more than seven months into Israel's massive air, sea and ground offensive.
articles.title: Hamas rocket attack from Gaza sets off air raid sirens in Tel Aviv for the first time in months

articles.author: WILL WEISSERT
articles.description: WASHINGTON (AP) — Donald Trump was booed repeatedly while addressing the Libertarian Party National Convention on Saturday night, with many in the crowd shouting insults and decrying him for things like his COVID-19 policies, running up towering federal deficits and lying about his political record.
articles.title: Trump, accustomed to friendly crowds, confronts repeated booing during Libertarian convention speech

articles.author: MARK KENNEDY
articles.description: NEW YORK (AP) — Richard M. Sherman, one half of the prolific, award-winning pair of brothers who helped form millions of childhoods by penning the instantly memorable songs for "Mary Poppins," "The Jungle Book" and "Chitty Chitty Bang Bang" — as well as the most-played tune on Earth, "It's a Small World (After All)" — has died.
articles.title: Richard M. Sherman, who fueled Disney charm in 'Mary Poppins' and 'It's a Small World,' dies at 95

articles.author: JOHN O'CONNOR
articles.description: SPRINGFIELD, Ill. (AP) — The Abraham Lincoln Presidential Library and Museum is once again under the spotlight after a manager failed to consult a collections committee before purchasing a 21-star flag whose description as a rare banner marking Illinois' 1818 admission to the Union is disputed.
articles.title: A 19th century flag disrupts leadership at an Illinois museum and prompts a state investigation

articles.author: ROD McGUIRK
articles.description: MELBOURNE, Australia (AP) — The International Organization for Migration on Sunday increased its estimate of the death toll from a massive landslide in Papua New Guinea to more than 670 as emergency responders and traumatized relatives gave up hope that any survivors will now be found.
articles.title: Over 670 people died in a massive Papua New Guinea landslide, UN estimates, as survivors seek safety

articles.author: JILL LAWLESS
articles.description: LONDON (AP) — All 18-year-olds in Britain will have to perform a year of mandatory military or civilian national service if the governing Conservative Party wins the July 4 national election, the party said Sunday.
articles.title: Sunak’s plan to make 18-year-olds do national service grabs attention on UK election trail

articles.author: BEN NUCKOLS
articles.description: When Balu Natarajan became the first Indian American champion of the Scripps National Spelling Bee in 1985, a headline on an Associated Press article read, “Immigrants’ son wins National Spelling Bee,” with the first paragraph noting the champion “speaks his parents’ native Indian language at home.”
articles.title: National Spelling Bee reflects the economic success and cultural impact of immigrants from India

articles.author: DOUG FERGUSON
articles.description: Two-time PGA Tour winner Grayson Murray died Saturday morning at age 30, one day after he withdrew from the Charles Schwab Cup Challenge at Colonial.
articles.title: Grayson Murray dies at age 30 a day after withdrawing from Colonial, PGA Tour says

articles.author: RODRIGO ABD and FRANKLIN BRICEÑO
articles.description: BELÉN, Peru (AP) — In the heart of Peru’s Amazon region, a poor Indigenous community put aside the trials and tribulations of everyday life and celebrated an international film festival with works from countries with tropical forests.
articles.title: Indigenous community in the heart of Peru's Amazon hosts film festival celebrating tropical forests
